website_summaries.verdict: The Merrell Vapor Glove 3, an affordable running shoe option, found itself in a unique situation, where the positive and negative feedback had come from the same people. The shoe was praised for being a comfortable minimalist shoe that had practical features and superb performance, yet it was also criticized – by the same users – for its durability. Overall, the Vapor Glove 3 was a good shoe, but many runners think it is not a worthy purchase because of its short lifespan.
pros: The outsole provided a stable grip, a satisfied runner said
The Merrell Vapor Glove 3 was a lightweight and flexible shoe that enabled a relaxed run, according to a wearer
Many users enjoyed the shoe’s minimal weight
The Glove 3 is a comfortable shoe with sufficient ground sensitivity, a buyer
Some consumers thought the Vapor Glove 3 was an affordable shoe
One runner was amazed at how the shoe improved their running gait
A couple of purchasers mentioned that the third version of the Vapor Glove brought better arch support compared to its previous generations
cons: Several users reported the shoe’s upper and outsole separating after just a few uses
The midfoot area has an inaccurate fit, a runner stated
The upper mesh started to deteriorate within a few months of usage, according to few disappointed wearers
Some runners found the shoe to be too stiff
One buyer felt the toe box was small, and that it gave the foot cramps
The outsole of the Vapor Glove quickly wore out, a consumer said

customer_reviews.title: Interesting
customer_reviews.text: The lighter, softer, more breathable barefoot shoe than any of my vivos. But also seems less durable, and sole less protective... I only walk in these so can't put them through real wear test, and is just used for 2 or 3 months but I kind of see where the money goes when you buy vivos over these. It's a different kind of shoe though. Feels like an ultimate slipper and can be worn in hot weather, and disappear on your feet.. and good colours too. I like these things about them.
customer_reviews.author: Jj

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for flat feet or broken toes
customer_reviews.text: 60 miles so far, mostly running 7.5 minute miles on tarmac and gravel. I balance them with my Asics Kayanos. Stops any pain from platar fasciitis for 2-3 days. At one point I had a gory accident that needed stitching on a toe. The wiggle room made these the only comfortable yet protective option for my bandage, and meant I could walk around cautiously, rather than remain housebound. Yes, everybody stared at me hobbling around in my brightly coloured shoes. I usually buy size UK 10.5-11 trainers and am UK 10.5 for the Merrell Vapor Glove 3. In my experience, they're only suitable for dry weather. Squelchy in the rain.
customer_reviews.author: plazabazaar

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and nicely fitting shoes...
customer_reviews.text: Was excited to try these on as soon as they arrived and they didn’t disappoint. I’ve been using Vivo’s for a number of years now but more recently they didn’t seem to have my size in stock. I waited for months but still no joy. So, I thought I’d give these a go and I’m glad I did. Great fit. Comfortable and just enough cushioning in the sole so you can still feel the ground. Like the Vivo’s, the finish isn’t fantastic but these are less than half the cost so I can’t complain. Even if they last 3 months I’ll be happy.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Nice bit of kit
customer_reviews.text: I bought these rather than the finger ones as I'd heard they were difficult to don and doff. They are very light, they have enough sole so that you can feel the ground but you don't get hurt. I have wide feet and these fit really well. I also am impressed with how my feet don't sweat whilst wearing them.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. P. L. Jones

customer_reviews.title: The best trainers in the world.
customer_reviews.text: I have had barefoot merrels since they were first released. These are the best trainers I have ever worn in my life. I don't know how long they will hold up, we will see. But even if they lasted for only a couple of months, I would be happy to continue purchasing them till the end of time. Till The End Of Time.
customer_reviews.author: Zakaria

customer_reviews.title: Merrell Vapor Glove 3
customer_reviews.text: Minimalist running shoe, nice looking,you can wear them on daily basis. Unfortunately, I had to return them as I have slightly uneven feet - I usually wear a size 9, I tried this model in a shp, size 9 1/2 and they were quite large at the toebox so I ordered size 9 from Amazon. Left shoe fitting nicely, right shoe toes right at the edge of toebox, rubbing against it. The return process was very easy, no fuss from the seller, full refund.
customer_reviews.author: Albert Dragomir

customer_reviews.title: Good Initially, but Terrible Quality
customer_reviews.text: Real shame as the feel and comfort for running was great - but the top part of the trainers is of a really low quality - the stitching is coming away from the sole and holes have appeared in the sides. I am no great distance runner so I'd be surprised if I'd more than 75 miles in them. Shame as I have been looking for a reasonably priced minimalist shoe for a while and I thought I'd found them here.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So
customer_reviews.text: I have a pair of the Merrill barefoot toe shoes and I love the way they feel but I have been told they look a bit freaky, pleased I have found these, they are so comfortable, I love going barefoot so this is the next best thing.
customer_reviews.author: Mid Life

customer_reviews.title: best barefoot shoe
customer_reviews.text: I own a few vivobarefoot and other branded zero drop and barefoot shoes. To me these are the best I have ever tried. In fact these is my second pair. The only let down is the upper which tends to go before everything else. That might be due to the sole which is so incredibly good. Running in these is a true dream.
customer_reviews.author: O J.

customer_reviews.title: Go a half size down
customer_reviews.text: Love the shoes. They're exactly what I want from a barefoot-style shoe without getting as many weird looks as a five-fingers style shoe. However, I'd recommend going a half size down from what you're used to if you normally wear a different brand of shoe as they seem to run a little large, and that's particularly noticeable with something so minimalist.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: ... 2 pairs of the Merrell Road Glove which were brilliant and have tried these as an alternative
customer_reviews.text: I have previously had 2 pairs of the Merrell Road Glove which were brilliant and have tried these as an alternative. So far very pleased, they are extremely comfortable. Soles feel slightly thinner than the Road Glove and so tend to feel sharp stones a bit more. Only criticism of the Road Glove is how long the soles last, so we will see how these do.
customer_reviews.author: lazygraham

customer_reviews.title: No good for wide feet.
customer_reviews.text: Always had size 8 UK for Merrell shoes -- always fitted well. I was led to believe by other reviews that these had loads of room for the toes as they are barefoot style shoes. In reality they are tighter than normal Merrells. Should have bought size 9s. Unfortunately sending stuff back to Amazon is a nightmare from our post office here in Portugal -- so now I am in the market for a shoe stretcher -- any recommendations welcome.
customer_reviews.author: Norm Tucker

customer_reviews.title: Just started barefoot running and these are a great starter. Comfy and lightweight
customer_reviews.text: Just started barefoot running and these are a great starter. Comfy and lightweight. Only issue is they are not windproof at all so expect to get cold toes!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good minimal gym trainers
customer_reviews.text: I use these for indoor gym training. Mainly barbell exercise such as Deadlifts and Squats, also some light jogging/jumping. All good so far.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan J

customer_reviews.title: Barefoot
customer_reviews.text: Good quality barefoot shoe. However, poor fit. Had to go a size smaller than I normally wear.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: great running shoes, fit nicely and comfortable to run in
customer_reviews.author: Mat

customer_reviews.title: Great running shoes
customer_reviews.text: Used as expected for running. Does change your stride as very little cushion on the heal which is the idea, suprisingly comfortable. Worn for a day out to try and feet felt fine at the end. Quility is usual merrell so no worries there
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Great Fit
customer_reviews.text: A true minimalist shoe with enough protection from rough surfaces. I have slim feet but the shoe fits well with great room in the toe box. Breaking them in slowly and building up my runs, as I've only had these for a couple of weeks I can't comment on their durability.
customer_reviews.author: tom moore

customer_reviews.title: Barely there feel
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable minimalist running shoe. Very light . Sole provides just enough protection and a great feel of what's underfoot.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Glue failed
customer_reviews.text: The shoe was pretty much what I expected but the glue failed after less than 40k running
customer_reviews.author: Lasse Jorgensen

customer_reviews.title: Build quality of a shoe twice the price
customer_reviews.text: hi-quality, nice wide toe box, lightweight and good grip. Shoe breaths nicely.
customer_reviews.author: MR O STROUD

customer_reviews.title: Spot on
customer_reviews.text: Very well made pair of shoes. I am new to barefoot running and it takes time to get accustomed to them. Still Impressed after 3 weeks though.
customer_reviews.author: P

customer_reviews.title: My favorite minimalist running shoe.
customer_reviews.text: Probably my favorite minimalist running shoe right now. I've tried several Vibram FiveFingers and Vivobarefoot models but these seem to have the best fit. Really love these.
customer_reviews.author: Richard van der Velde

customer_reviews.title: Foot strength
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are great for strengthening your feet. Ordered these again as I have felt the benefits of using them previously. Comfortable like a pair of slippers!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Too small
customer_reviews.text: Had to return these as too small. Waiting for the 1.5 size bigger version.
customer_reviews.author: Lara

customer_reviews.title: Fab!
customer_reviews.text: I have barely taken them off since I opened the box.
customer_reviews.author: Footman

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: They are great. Wide fitting and ultra comfy. Wear them all the time!
customer_reviews.author: martin j lamb

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend newcomers to just have a few long walks before ...
customer_reviews.text: My first minimalist running shoes. Took me a few times to adjust (have been using Gel-Kayano and some shoes from New Balance before). I would recommend newcomers to just have a few long walks before trying to run at speed. Once I got used to them I don't see myself going back to 'normal' running shoes. They fit as expected based on the table provided, given you don't use socks (I don't). If you want to run with socks (but why would you with minimalist shoes?), take them a little bigger.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas A.

customer_reviews.title: Poor Product!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve only worn these for two months and they’ve started to fall apart already. Can’t seem to contact the seller to resolve the issue. Stick to Vivos!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Ross James Clark

customer_reviews.title: Takes time to adjust
customer_reviews.text: Bought several barefoot shoes for running and hiking. Left these in storage. Maybe should have persevered for longer!
customer_reviews.author: David  Finlay

product_meta.title: Merrell Men's Vapor Glove 3 Trail Running Shoes
product_meta.description: Minimal look. Maximum performance. This barefoot shoe has a sock like feel for a locked down fit, plus a vibram sole with nearly zero ground to foot separation.
feature_bullets: Box contents: One pair of Vapor Glove 3 trail running shoes
